comments:
I have migrated my plugins to 3.0 M7 using the PDE migrate utility. I have 
verified that the compatibility runtime module is imported in my plugin.xml. I 
am using the Sun JRE 1.4.2_03, but I have also tried with Sun JRE 1.4.1_02. 
Everything compiles fine, but I can not run my plugins in the runtime 
environment. I get the following stack trace:

The super class for my UI plugin is AbstractUIPlugin. I have defined my default 
contructer as:

 public CAHUIPlugin(IPluginDescriptor descriptor)
    {
        super(descriptor);
        ...
        ...

    } // end constructor

The plugins work fine in Eclipse 2.0 and 2.1.2.

I believe there was a bug in M7 which exhibited this behaviour (can't find the 
number right now).  It was a combination of the AbstractUIPlugin not 
implementing the default constructor and a problem in the runtime's logic for 
creating the BundleActivator.

Please retry on M8 and reopen if it is still a problem.  If it is, please 
attach the manifest.mf file generated for your plugin (this is found in the 
manifests directory in your configuration area).
